ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: So the true question is why don t we like twinks? Is it because they have an unfair advantage in leveling (high level buffs do the same thing)? Or is it that
ygData.messageBody:
So the true question is why don't we like twinks?
Is it because they have an unfair advantage in
leveling (high level buffs do the same thing)? Or is it
that they flaunt it?<br><br>I recently started an
Iksar monk. I made it through lvl 6 on my own, but then
a friend giving up EQ seriously twinked me. So, I'm
flighting white/yellows instead of blues. I'm leveling
quickly, I'm already 12. I don't flaunt it, etc. But it
does get annoying the number of characters that
inspect me now. ;) <br><br>I was also given a large
amount of plat, but I doubt I'll use any of it until the
mid-twenties. Monks don't have to buy spells...this is my first
non-caster...wow, does money add up quickly!<br><br>Now, twinks
that want to duel? That's just plain mean! And of
course, I don't think twinking is cool on PVP
servers...it really is an unfair advantage. I do think that
certain items shouldn't be wearable until a certain level
on those servers.<br><br>As a self-reliant type game
goes, I'd have to disagree. I think EQ was built with
this type of thing in mind. Buffing, healing,
twinking...it's all very similar to me. Cast a skin like diamond,
a regen, SOW, STR, a DS, and a Clarity (for a
newbie caster), on a low-level person and they can fight
yellows pretty easily. Granted, it's temporary, but when
I had Breeze/Clarity cast on me, I could usually
get one full bub of exp instead of 1 blue
bub!<br><br>Happy hunting!<br><br>CoJim, Druid of the 26th
season<br>Shaojiku, Monk of the 12th trial<br>Prexus server
